results.title: Heart Attacks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Explains the oxygen supply to the heart. Examines various abnormal heart conditions. Signs and symptoms for angina and coronary occlusion and emergency treatment required.

results.title: Airway
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Explains the anatomy of the upper and lower airway and, how simply it can become partially or totally blocked; the signs and symptoms of a partially blocked and totally blocked airway and the emergency treatment required under both conditions.

results.title: Burns
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Causes and types of burns. Emergency treatment required. Looks closely at the treatment of a burnt leg and examines the situation of burns around the head and neck area which may have a serious effect on the patient’s ability to breathe. Treatment of the patient’s emotional state.

results.title: Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Function, location and anatomy of heart. Explains pulse and where to locate. With resuscitation model explains external compression and moves onto cardio-pulmonary resuscitation, firstly with one rescuer and then two rescuers. Based on the method taught by the Australian resuscitation council.

results.title: Blast furnace
results.brief_description: Elementary treatment illustrating processes by which iron ore is smelted in a blast furnace to produce cast iron. The following aspects are covered: layout of furnace, pre-heating and other plant; raw materials used and method of charging furnace; operation of furnace; tapping of slag and molten metal; sealing tap holes; castings of molten metal into pigs.
results.description: Elementary treatment illustrating processes by which iron ore is smelted in a blast furnace to produce cast iron. results.title: Blast
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1914, Ezra Pound, Wyndham Lewis, Gaudier-Brska and others published “Blast”, the manifesto of the Vorticist movement. Their aim was to disrupt the Edwardian conventions of the Royal Academy and to introduce an alternative artistic vocabulary. The film gives an account of the activities of the Vorticists. Script by Richard Cork, photography by David Peat, music by Ron Geesin.

results.title: Black Sunday
results.brief_description: Depicts the devastation caused by the notorious ‘Black Sunday’ bushfires of 1926, that wiped out the south-east of Victoria.

results.title: Black patch
results.creator_credit: Thomas J. Brandon and Central Documentary Films
results.brief_description: A breathtaking story of animal adventure which will arouse children’s sympathy for wild animals, teach them about animals’ adaptation to particular geographic conditions, and show them authentic pictures of a strange place, full of wonder and beauty. Set in the ice-clad Tian-Shan range in central Asia, the story of Black Patch, the little goat, is told - how he grows up to lead the wild herd of mountain goats to safety in their flight from wolves and hunters. (Features a white panther with markings similar to a jaguar or leopard as one of the predators of the goats.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thomas J. Brandon and Central Documentary Films

results.title: Black and white: a creative leisure film
results.brief_description: Children’s drawings in black and white. Finger and brush painting using poster colours and crayons. Shows the technique of applying paint with rollers over paper having a crayon drawing which remains distinct so as to obtain a reverse copy on dampened paper which looks like a negative print.
